text: errymedia.co en blog posts the evolution of content marketing to attract and retain audiences. Castleberry Media        HomeServicesStrategyProductionDistributionVirtual InfluencersMindpathBlogAbout UsOur Green InitiativeContactSpanishEnSpEnSpThe evolution of content marketing to attract and retain audiencesStrategyJanuary 21, 2022Most people think that Content Marketing is an innovative and novel business strategy, when in fact it is older than many people think.According to the Content Marketing Institute, the first Content Marketing strategy dates back to 1891, when American entrepreneur August Oeketer decided to market a baking powder for home consumption accompanied by small recipes on the back of the product packaging, to educate consumers about the use and nutritional benefits of his brand. Oeketer achieved such success that twenty years later, he published a cookbook that became one of the best-selling cookbooks of its time with 19 million copies printed worldwide.It is clear that Content Marketing is nothing new, but it can be said that the emergence of the Internet led to the democratization and popularization of Content Marketing. This shift has allowed any kind of company â including SMEs and Startups â to generate their own content, without having to invest large amounts of resources in this type of strategy, in order to attract more leads and retain a greater number of customers.Nonetheless, this situation poses a great challenge for brands today, as it is increasingly difficult for them to attract the attention of their audiences with relevant, attractive, and useful content. Particularly when there are millions of options available to them at the click of a button for information and entertainment when surfing the web. For this reason, companies like Castleberry Media are investing heavily in programs and methods based on data and artificial intelligence, to help brands simplify and automate their internal processes for selecting, creating, and distributing content so that they have the desired impact on their audiences.The creation of relevant and quality content for the right audiences is not an easy task. On the contrary, it requires a more scientific and rigorous process from brands, where the choice of the topics to be explored depends on the information provided by data on the needs and preferences of the audiences and not, as it happens today, on the âguessesâ or âhunchesâ of the editorial teams.How can this be achieved? In this article, you will find the answer.Content Marketing: from future to realityâThe television revolution that began half a century ago spawned a number of industries, including the manufacturing of TV sets, but the long-term winners were those who used the medium to deliver information and entertainmentâ¦ Content is where I expect much of the real money will be made on the Internet.âThis was what Bill Gates wrote in his opinion column in 1996, entitled âContent is kingâ, in reference to the approach that companiesâ marketing strategies should take in the Internet era that was just beginning. And the truth is, he wasnât wrong. According to statistics from HubSpot, 70% of business decision-makers invest in content marketing strategies, because they know that a large part of consumers prefer to learn about a product through high-impact and high-value content, rather than through traditional advertising.âFor example, U.S. companies that have a blog have 126% higher lead generation than those that donât,â according to a study by the Impact agency. âThis happens in a context in which 77% of Internet users read blogs regularlyâ. These figures undoubtedly demonstrate the degree of effectiveness and receptiveness that strategies based on Content Marketing have on both consumers and companies themselves.Globally, some of the companies that have succeeded in developing this type of strategy are American Express, Bayer, and, of course, Microsoft Corporation. Through its blog âHistory Story Labs,â Microsoft shares and celebrates the most inspiring stories of the industry that, through technology, science, and innovation, are transforming the world and the way people live and relate to each other.In Colombia, one of the brands most recognized for successfully implementing Content Marketing is Bancolombia. Through its digital platforms such as âCapital Inteligenteâ, âInnovaciÃ³n y TransformaciÃ³n Digitalâ and âActualÃ­zateâ, Bancolombia shares information and specialized knowledge with its customers about financial education, ecosystems for entrepreneurs in the region, and programs for SMEs, respectively.Guesswork: the big issue with Content Marketing today Although many brands are currently using Content Marketing, most of them continue to implement their strategies based on intuition or inspiration rather than resorting to more effective or scientific methods, such as data. In other words, what currently dominates the process of selection, creation, and distribution of content within them, is guesswork (letâs see if this topic works), intuition (this may interest my audience), and even past experience (if this worked before, it may work again). While this may work during the first few months, as time goes by, imagination inevitably falls short on editorial teams, so the question âWhat are we going to write about this month?â is not only becoming more frequent, but even worse, generating more frustration among editors. It also encourages us to make the common mistakes in this type of situation: repeating topics, creating content that does not engage the audience, adopting a more promotional style, and -in the end- believing that Content Marketing is not useful. Other companies, on the other hand, appeal to traditional and/or basic tools to know their audiences, such as SEO Keyword Research (which may improve the positioning of content in search engines by including keywords used by the audiences on the web) or Buyer Persona (which recreates a fictitious profile of the ideal client based on data). While these approaches help to identify the general characteristics of the audience, they do not establish deeper and more determining aspects about their needs and interests. For example the type of language they use, the content they consume, or their personal opinions about it.Consequently, the truth is that most brands are not implementing their Content Marketing strategies in the most efficient way, as they continue to appeal to traditional resources or â even worse â Â resort to guesswork to identify the needs and desires of their audiences to create the content that they believe is most useful and attractive to them. Contrary to the early years of the Internet, where the goal of brands was to create content at all costs, the success of Content Marketing today is based on generating the most relevant and useful content possible, to achieve the greatest engagement with audiences.How to achieve this? Itâs very simple: through data. Data: the right approach to impactful contentIf it is no longer enough for brands to simply create content to succeed in Content Marketing, but rather they must create the best possible content for their audiences. Â To do so, they must begin by getting to know these audiences in depth in order to have more detailed and accurate information about their tastes, desires, and interests.To achieve this, the only possible approach is through data.Thatâs why companies like Castleberry Media have developed tools that allow companies to collect as much data as possible about the content consumed by their customers and leads, in order to analyze it and develop the most targeted and relevant content for them.In this way, companiesâ decisions regarding content (such as the selection of topics, positioning, format, and keywords) are based on real data and facts, instead of intangible elements such as intuition or guesses, reaching the objectives initially established without having to waste the companyâs finite resources, including time and money.Many times a brand can easily determine its target audience and build a functional customer journey around it, but it struggles to determine the type of content that will generate the most engagement. This is where data and, above all, Artificial Intelligence play a decisive role, as they help to improve and optimize the delivery of more relevant and attractive content for increasingly selective audiences.Artificial Intelligence: predicting and measuring content strategiesWhile data allows brands to know their audiences in depth (to develop the most attractive and useful content possible according to their needs and interests), Artificial Intelligence gives them the possibility to know if those pieces of content will achieve the desired impact and engagement, even before they are published. Taking Content Marketing to a level of predictability of results never seen before.According to Luisa Echeverry, Business Lead at Castleberry Media, â Artificial Intelligence (AI) algorithms allow brands to optimize their content by determining whether or not the article they produced fits the parameters of the best content in the world for that audience; based on its tone, grammatical structure, writing style, and even sentiment.âIn addition to predicting the future performance of each piece of editorial content, AI also gives marketing teams the opportunity to make the best distribution and positioning decisions so that their content achieves the desired visibility and impact. âFor example, at Castleberry Media, we have our own AI algorithm called âContent Placement Score,â which calculates the probability that the analyzed article looks like the best articles published for that audience in the world. So, if there is a high degree of similarity, it prompts marketing teams to amplify (distribute) the content, by investing in advertising, placing it in the header as the main headline of their blog, or including it in the companyâs newsletter. Thus improving its visibility and positioning in both search engines and customer preferences,â adds Luisa Echeverry.True Content: the evolution of Content MarketingIf the Internet gave brands the opportunity to venture into Content Marketing through mass communication channels, data and Artificial Intelligence will allow companies to optimize their resources to the fullest, to ensure that their content strategies achieve the desired objectives on their audiences.That is why Castleberry Media has developed a tool called TRUE CONTENT, which allows brands to understand how to build the most effective B2B content, based on data analysis and Artificial Intelligence, and to discover what their audiences are reading, talking about, and consuming. Thus transforming Content Marketing into an analytical and scientific process based on data, rather than one based on guesswork or instinct.But what exactly can brands do with TRUE CONTENT?Get to know audiences like never before, through the topics they consume, what they read, what they talk about, what they are interested in, and what they care about.Monitor what your competitors are doing to know what content, topics, and keywords they are using to communicate with the audience you want to reach, in order to highlight and differentiate your own content strategies from the rest.Use Artificial Intelligence to know in advance if their content has the right tone, sentiment, and keywords to generate the desired engagement with the audience, based on the best content in the world related to that topic.Identify the writers on their editorial teams who, due to their profile and writing style, are best suited to the content they want to produce and to the special attributes of the selected audience.In Castleberry Media we are commited to taking care of our planet, therefore, this content is responsible with the environment. text: errymedia.co en blog posts the power of storytelling in b2b content marketing why b2b companies should embrace it. Castleberry Media        HomeServicesStrategyProductionDistributionVirtual InfluencersMindpathBlogAbout UsOur Green InitiativeContactSpanishEnSpEnSpThe Power of Storytelling in B2B Content Marketing: Why B2B Companies Should Embrace ItContent MarketingJanuary 31, 2023In today's digital world, content marketing has become a crucial tool for businesses of all sizes to engage with their target audience and develop brand awareness and loyalty. According to a recent report by the Content Marketing Institute, 86% of B2B marketers use content marketing to achieve their business goals, with brand awareness being one of the top objectives. However, not all content is created equal. To truly connect with and captivate your audience, it's crucial to incorporate storytelling into your content marketing strategy.According to a study by Forbes Insights, consumers are 80% more likely to remember a brand or product if it is connected to a story. Brand awareness and customer loyalty require storytelling since they can arouse emotions and establish a closer bond with the audience. In addition, a study by Business2Community discovered that when businesses use narrative in their content marketing, engagement and brand loyalty rise by 20%.The power of storytelling in content marketing lies in its ability to give audiences engaging and lasting experiences. When done well, storytelling can help a business stand out from its rivals and develop a deep emotional bond with the audience that goes beyond the usual characteristics and advantages of a good or service. B2B brands may increase brand awareness and loyalty and uniquely engage their target audience by including storytelling in their content marketing efforts.The Role of Storytelling in Content MarketingSince ancient times, telling stories has been a crucial component of human expression and communication, and its impact goes far beyond simple entertainment or leisure. Scientifically speaking, storytelling has a profound effect on our psychological and emotional states, affecting the way we perceive and interpret information and how we connect and empathize with others. When a brand tells a story, it has the power to engage and captivate its target audience by eliciting feelings and building a stronger connection than simple messaging can.Storytelling in content marketing can assist brands in forging an emotional bond with their target market, which is crucial for promoting brand awareness and fostering customer loyalty. It has been demonstrated that storytelling works well for grabbing viewers' interest. As people are more likely to remember and be loyal to a brand they have an emotional connection with, this can translate into higher engagement, brand recall, and repeat business.Incorporating storytelling into content marketing is also a way to tap into the basic human instinct to share stories. We have been taught to communicate through stories since we were very little. It has been used to transmit knowledge, lessons, and values from one generation to the next and is essential to our societal progress. Due to audiences' innate propensity for storytelling, it is an excellent tool for brands to use when communicating their messaging because it gives information to them in an approachable and interesting way.Successful B2B organizations have already begun to use storytelling as a tool in their content marketing plans. Businesses like IBM and Microsoft have used storytelling to present their goods and services in an exciting and lasting way. For instance, IBM's "Made With IBM" series narrates how its technology is influencing the world for the better.The Hero's Journey in Content MarketingOne popular framework for storytelling in content marketing is the hero's journey. The hero's journey is a classic narrative structure that outlines a hero's journey from their ordinary world, through a series of trials and tribulations, to a final triumph. This structure can be applied to content marketing by using your brand or products as the hero and showcasing how they solve the challenges faced by your target audience.Creating a hero's journey for your B2B brand requires careful planning and consideration of the following steps:-Identifying your target audience: Understanding who your target audience is, their challenges, and their needs is the first step in creating a hero's journey for your B2B brand. Try to understand their needs through their search intent. You may use this knowledge to create a story that appeals to and interests them. Castleberry, for example, has True Content, a technological tool that allows it to understand the interests and search intents of its client's audiences.-Create a story that showcases your brand as the hero: After you've determined who your target market is and what their problems are, you can develop a narrative that features your brand or product as the hero who overcomes those problems. The narrative must be engaging, appealing, and pertinent to your intended audience.-Use a clear and engaging narrative structure: The hero's journey is a well-established narrative structure that has been used for centuries. When creating a hero's journey for your B2B brand, it is important to use a clear and engaging narrative structure that follows the hero's journey. This structure will help keep your story focused, organized, and easy to follow.-Use compelling visuals and media: It's crucial to use appealing pictures and media that captivate your target audience and help them connect to your business to bring your story to life. This can encompass audio, video, graphics, and more.-Promote your content through the proper channels: Last but not least, it's critical to promote your content via the appropriate channels if you want to connect with your target audience. Social media, email marketing, and other marketing techniques that successfully reach your target market can be used. Your hero's journey can reach the right audience and have the most significant effect by being promoted through the appropriate channels. Native distribution, for example, is an effective way to distribute content to the right audience through digital publications.Â Disruptive Ideas for Using Storytelling in Content MarketingYour B2B content marketing can be advanced by incorporating cutting-edge technologies and fresh approaches, which can also help you stand out in a crowded industry. Here are some disruptive concepts to think about:Interactive and Immersive Content: B2B brands can leverage virtual reality and gamification to create engaging and immersive storytelling experiences for their audience. This kind of material can assist B2B businesses in standing out from the competition and establishing a memorable connection with their target market.User-Generated Content: Encouraging your clients to share their narratives and experiences can be a powerful strategy for gaining the confidence and respect of your target market. User-generated content can position your brand as a dependable and active community member by becoming a part of your content marketing plan.Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning: Leveraging artificial intelligence and machine learning in your content marketing can help to personalize and optimize your storytelling for your target audience. AI can help to analyze and understand your audience, their preferences, and behaviors, enabling you to deliver tailored and relevant content that resonates with them. At Castleberry, we believe in the power of data and AI (True Content) to help B2B brands understand their audience and deliver relevant and engaging content.Â ConclusionIn conclusion, any effective B2B content marketing plan must incorporate storytelling. Storytelling's strength is its capacity to elicit strong emotional responses from viewers, foster brand recognition and adherence, and produce memorable and compelling experiences.To compete in the modern digital environment, marketing executives and B2B medium and big enterprises must embrace the power of storytelling in their content marketing strategy. Companies that adopt these cutting-edge methods will be well-positioned to connect with their target audience in a meaningful and lasting way. SourcesB2B Marketing. text: errymedia.co en blog posts unlocking the power of content marketing proven tactics for generating leads and boosting sales. Castleberry Media        HomeServicesStrategyProductionDistributionVirtual InfluencersMindpathBlogAbout UsOur Green InitiativeContactSpanishEnSpEnSpUnlocking the Power of Content Marketing: Proven Tactics for Generating Leads and Boosting SalesFebruary 13, 2023In the current digital era, content marketing has emerged as an essential strategy for every company wanting to boost leads and sales. But with so many channels and platforms alternatives, knowing where to begin can be difficult. This article will dive into the strategies and tactics you need to know to make the most of your content marketing efforts and unlock its true potential.Tactic 1: Understanding the Buyer's Journey: The Secret to Creating a Successful Content Marketing StrategyThe buyer's journey is the process potential customers go through as they move from awareness of your product or service to making a purchase. It's typically divided into three stages: awareness, consideration, and decision.At the awareness stage, potential customers are just starting to learn about your product or service. They may have a problem or a need, but they have yet to decide how to solve it. During this phase, the purpose of your content should be to inform and educate your target audience. For instance, a SaaS provider may write a blog post outlining companies' typical issues while managing remote workers and how their software solves them.As potential customers move into the consideration stage, they evaluate solutions to their problem or need. At this point, they're looking for more in-depth information and are starting to compare different options. During this phase, the emphasis of your content should be on educating your audience while demonstrating the worth of your product or service.Â Finally, in the decision stage, potential customers are ready to purchase. At this point, your content should now be geared toward closing the sale. A financial advisor, for instance, may write a whitepaper comparing various investment possibilities while outlining why their services are the best option.As the basic principle of content marketing states, always consider creating valuable content, not promotional content. If you mention your products, ensure they are introduced subtly and coherently.Â Â Tactic 2: Developing a Successful Content Marketing Plan: From Goal-Setting to Success-MeasuringOnce you understand the buyer's journey, it's time to create a content marketing plan focusing on lead generation and sales. Four steps can be taken to accomplish this:Step 1: Effective content marketing strategies require a clear understanding of your target audience. This process entails investigating your target market's demographics, problems, and purchasing patterns. You may use this knowledge to produce content that speaks directly to their interests and needs.âTrue Content is a powerful tool that can help companies in various industries identify their target audiences' interests and information needs. By using True Content, a real estate company can gain a deeper understanding of its target market, including the kind of content they are engaging with and content topics they are interested in. This information can be used to create content that speaks directly to their target audience's needs and interests, increasing the chances of generating leads and sales.Step 2: Setting Specific Goals: Once you understand your target audience, it's time to set specific, measurable goals. In the example of a real estate firm, the objective might be to produce 20% more leads from their website in the upcoming quarter. This objective ought to be clear, quantifiable, and doable.Step 3: Creating a Content Calendar: With your target market and goals in mind, it's time to create a content calendar. This calendar should include a mix of blog posts, videos, and infographics that address the different stages of the home-buying process. Your target audience should be educated and entertained by this content, which should encourage them to take action, like completing a form or setting up a meeting.Step 4: Measuring Your Success: It's crucial to monitor your development to ensure your content marketing efforts yield the proper outcomes. Using analytics and other data, you may learn which content is most successful at generating leads and revenue. You can modify your approach and content calendar based on this data to meet your objectives.It is also a good idea to think about producing robust content like eBooks, whitepapers, and studies to increase leads and sales. You can use this content to get lead information from your intended audience. Users can leave their contact information in exchange for the valuable information in these materials, giving you access to a great database of possible leads.Tactic 3: Nurturing Leads with Targeted Content: How to Keep Your Audience Engaged and Move Them Closer to a SaleOne of the most powerful ways to use content marketing to generate leads and close sales is to nurture leads with targeted content. This can be done through various channels such as email campaigns, social media, or webinars.For example, a fashion e-commerce store can create a series of email campaigns triggered based on the actions a customer takes on their website. If a customer viewsa product page multiple times but doesn't make a purchase, they can receive an email with a special offer or discount code. If customers leave something in their shopping cart, they may get an email containing everything they forgot and a promotional offer. The e-commerce business may improve its odds of turning that lead into a sale by offering relevant, timely content related to where a consumer is in their purchase path.As leads move deeper into the funnel, they may be more interested in learning about your product or service's specific features and benefits. You can create content such as case studies or product demos that showcase the value of your product or service. Or you can create customized content that speaks to their specific needs and concerns.Â To enhance your content potential for nurturing, you can also rely on technological tools such as Mindpath. Mindpath is a powerful tool that can help companies achieve their content marketing goals by identifying potential clients, understanding what information they are interested in, and creating content paths to persuade and position your brand in their minds.By identifying potential clients and understanding their interests, Mindpath can create content that speaks directly to their needs and positions your brand in the best light. Furthermore, Mindpath's capacity to organize and initiate targeted content campaigns automatically can contribute to ensuring that the appropriate content is distributed to the right audience at the appropriate time.By using Mindpath, the store can increase its chances of converting leads into sales by providing valuable and timely content that speaks directly to where a customer is in their buying journey.Tactic 4: Addressing Objections and Building Trust: How to Use Content to Overcome the Barriers to PurchaseBy addressing the most frequent objections prospective consumers have, content marketing can also be used to close more sales. Consumers' most typical questions regarding your product or service can be addressed through blog articles, videos, or other information.For instance, a manufacturer of health supplements may produce a series of videos that respond to the most frequent questions consumers have regarding the efficacy and safety of their goods. The manufacturer of health supplements can gain the trust of prospective clients and improve their chances of making a sale by directly addressing these concerns.Tactic 5: "The Power of Storytelling: How to Create Emotional Connections and Drive Sales"A disruptive statement that would be considered a unique point of view is that creating a content marketing plan that focuses on storytelling will be more effective in driving sales than focusing on features and benefits. Building trust with potential clients and connecting with them via storytelling is incredibly effective. Making emotional connections with your audience through storytelling may help you close more deals.An example would be a travel agency telling the tale of a couple who took the same package and the memories they made rather than just stating the features and advantages of a luxury vacation package. The travel firm can improve its chances of making a sale by developing an emotional bond with the potential client.Tactic 6: "Consistency is Key: How to Keep Your Content Marketing Efforts On Track"It's important to remember that consistency is key when it comes to content marketing. To drive sales, you need to consistently create and publish high-quality content that addresses the problems and needs of your target market.A B2B software company may promise to send a monthly newsletter, hold quarterly webinars, and publish a new blog post weekly. The software company can ensure that its target market is continually engaged with its brand and boost the likelihood of making a deal by committing to a regular content generation and dissemination plan.Tactic 7: "Scaling Your Content Creation: How to Produce High-Quality Content at Scale"Creating high-quality content can be time-consuming and resource-intensive, but it's essential for driving leads and sales. One effective way to scale your content creation is by recording internal meetings and interviews with your company's top people.For example, a company can record weekly meetings where department heads present updates and new ideas. These recordings can be cut up into manageable chunks and used as a blog or social media content for the business. The business can also interview important team members, like the CEO or CTO, and use the recorded conversations to produce videos highlighting the company's knowledge and thought leadership.A business can produce a consistent stream of high-quality content utilizing these internal resources, establishing them as authorities in their industry and fostering confidence among their target audience.ConclusionIn conclusion, content marketing is crucial for businesses looking to increase leads and drive sales in the digital age. By following these strategies and tactics, you can unlock the full potential of your content marketing efforts and achieve your business goals.SourcesOpen IAIn Castleberry Media we are commited to taking care of our planet, therefore, this content is responsible with the environment. Castleberry Media        HomeServicesStrategyProductionDistributionVirtual InfluencersMindpathBlogAbout UsOur Green InitiativeContactSpanishEnSpEnSpUsing Emotion in Content Marketing: A Powerful Tool for Brand MarketingContent MarketingFebruary 7, 2023Emotions are a powerful tool in marketing, and when it comes to content marketing, leveraging emotions can be the key to unlocking a brand's full potential. In particular, the Content Marketing Institute argues that one of the most popular methods utilized in content strategies today to comprehend and affect consumer behavior is psychology.With B2B companies becoming increasingly focused on developing and implementing content marketing strategies, understanding the impact of emotions in these efforts is critical. In fact, 95% of our purchasing decisions are made in the subconscious mind, according to Gerald Zaltaman, a professor at Harvard Business School, in his most recent book, How Customers Think: Essential Insights into the Mind of the Market.In this post, we'll look at the advantages of including emotions in content marketing, how to do it well, and why B2B businesses should give it some thought.Benefits of Incorporating Emotions and Persuasion in Content MarketingWhen it comes to content marketing, emotions can differ between an average and a memorable campaign. Here are some benefits of incorporating emotions into your content marketing efforts:Increased Engagement and Connection with Target Audience: Emotional content can connect with consumers deeper, increasing engagement and building a relationship between the business and the target audience. This connection can drive engagement and encourage consumers to interact with the brand and its content.Building Brand Loyalty: Emotional content can help build brand loyalty by creating a solid connection between the consumer and the brand. This connection encourages consumers to choose the brand over its competitors and to become advocates for the brand.Stand Out from Competitors: Emotional content may help a business differentiate itself from its rivals and make it simpler for customers to recall the brand and its message.Improved Brand Recognition and Recall: By giving customers a memorable experience, emotional content can help increase brand recognition and recall. Consumers are more likely to remember a brand with strong emotional content.Increased Customer Advocacy and Word-of-Mouth Marketing: Emotional content can increase customer advocacy and word-of-mouth advertising. When customers identify emotionally with a brand, they are more inclined to tell others about their positive experiences, which increases brand visibility and traffic.Potential to tap into viral marketing through shareable content: Emotional content has the potential to go viral, creating massive exposure for the brand. Customers who experience intense emotions through a brand's content are more likely to share it with others, leading to viral exposure and increased brand recognition.Understanding How To Use Emotions in Content MarketingEmotions are powerful drivers of behavior. They can influence our actions, thoughts, and decisions. In content marketing, emotions are key to building relationships and connecting with audiences. By tapping into the emotions of your target audience, you can create content that not only engages and informs but also inspires and motivates.Various inputs, such as sensory signals, personal experiences, and societal influences, can cause emotions to arise. Marketers aware of the psychology underlying emotions can produce content that connects with consumers more deeply. When developing content, marketers should take into account a variety of aspects, such as tone, sentiment, and readability level, all of which significantly impact the reader's emotions. Marketers may produce content that connects more deeply and creates a lasting impression by considering these factors.To effectively use emotions in content marketing, it's important to understand the different types of emotions and how they can be used to influence your audience. The Myers-Briggs Type Indicator, which divides people into four different personality types, is one technique for understanding emotions:Understanding the personality types of your target audience will enable you to produce content that appeals to their emotional preferences. For example, a B2B company selling software solutions to large corporations may target ISTJs with data-driven whitepapers and case studies while appealing to ENFPs with fun and creative infographics.The Psychology of Persuasion Behind Content MarketingÂ The goal of marketing has always been to engage consumers and motivate them to take action. This is even more true in the B2B market, where establishing connections and trust are crucial to closing deals. But how can you arouse interest in your company and its offerings? This is where Robert Cialdini's Principles of Persuasion come in.By understanding and applying these principles, B2B companies can create content that resonates with their target audience, generates engagement, and ultimately drives conversions. Here's a closer look at the six principles and how they can be integrated into B2B content marketing.A. ReciprocityThe principle of reciprocity states that people are likelier to do something for someone who has done something for them. Content marketing means creating valuable and relevant content that offers real value to your target audienceâfor example, providing a comprehensive white paper or e-book on a subject relevant to your industry. By providing helpful information, you are more likely to win over your target audience's trust and develop a relationship, even their contact information, which will pave the way for subsequent conversions.B. ScarcityAccording to the principle of scarcity, people value things more when they are scarce because they want what they can't have. This idea can be applied to B2B content marketing by developing limited-time offers or promoting information that is only accessible for a limited time. For instance, a B2B software provider could emphasize the product's value and instill a sense of urgency in potential customers to act by providing a free trial for a constrained period of time.Â Choosing the right offer is key to making the scarcity principle effective. Here are some types of offers:Â Limited-time offer: This simple persuasion technique runs to a specific date. This usually works for interactive content such as webinars and workshops.Â Limited unit offer: a limited quantity of a product or service is mentioned. A limited-unit offer works very well for persuading prospects to sign up for course-type content, for example.Â One-time offer: you can offer an opportunity only once in exchange for the prospect's data.C. AuthorityThe principle of authority states that people are more likely to follow the lead of experts and leaders in a field. This idea may be applied to B2B content marketing by positioning thought leaders and subject-matter experts within your company as authorities in your sector. For example, a B2B consulting company might produce a blog or video series in which its specialists discuss their expertise and perspectives on numerous subjects. This gives your target audience helpful knowledge and positions your brand as a thought leader in your sector.One effective way to achieve this is by implementing content marketing initiatives such as Castleberry's "Content At Scale." This initiative's goal, based on content documentation, is to capture expert interviews, meetings, and roundtables. From this documentation, various types of valuable aggregated content, including podcasts, blog posts, playground videos, and more, are then extracted and disseminated through multiple channels. By doing this, you can create a library of content featuring your experts and position your brand as a leading authority in your industry.Â D. ConsistencyThe principle of consistency states that people are more likely to comply with requests that are consistent with their past actions and beliefs. In B2B content marketing, you can use this principle by creating a sense of consistency and stability in your brand and messaging. For instance, a B2B manufacturing company could create a series of how-to videos showcasing its products' quality and reliability, together with value-added information. You can develop trust and position your brand as a trustworthy information source by continuously producing valuable and pertinent content.E. LikingThe principle of liking states that people are more likely to comply with requests from someone they like. In B2B content marketing, you can use this principle by creating content that connects with your target audience on a personal level. For instance, a B2B tech company could generate a series of employee profiles that showcase the personalities and interests of its team. This humanizes the brand and makes potential customers feel more connected to and invested in your business.Here are some tips to make your content more enjoyable:Know your audience's interests. In addition to creating your buyer persona, use tools such as True Content, a software developed by Castleberry that allows you to know the interests of your audience and their behavior and information consumption trends on the Internet.Â Based on the audience's understanding, create an optimized tone, sentiment, and readability to align with the audience.Write compelling titles with copywriting that engages the reader. If you know the 80/20 rule, you know that 80% of readers will only read the title.Â Work on an engaging introduction where you speak to the reader in the first person to generate more closeness.Â Use friendly images. Look for quality images that produce positive emotions.F. ConsensusThe principle of consensus states that people are more likely to comply with requests that are consistent with the actions of others. In B2B content marketing, you can use this principle by showcasing social proof and customer testimonials. For instance, a B2B software provider could provide a case study that highlights the accomplishments of its customers and illustrates how the product has aided them in achieving their objectives. Since potential consumers are more likely to be influenced by the actions and opinions of others in their field, sharing the experiences of others can help you build trust and credibility with them. This may result in more conversions and favorable responses to your marketing initiatives.To apply it successfully, brands can use some of the following resources:Â Share reviews on social networks and the blog: if others see positive opinions of the brand, they are likely to want to be part of it.Celebrate a certain number of followers or subscribers to demonstrate that the brand provides valuable content.Collaborate with influencers in your industry to share your content on social media or blogs.Â When promoting your contact form or newsletter subscription form, a good persuasion strategy is to add the number of your current subscribers. This will encourage readers to sign up themselves as well.ConclusionIn conclusion, including emotion in your content marketing strategies can be the key to realizing the full potential of your business. B2B organizations can forge a more profound and lasting connection with their target audience that will increase engagement and sales by comprehending the advantages of and how to use emotions in content marketing. Take advantage of this chance to advance your content marketing efforts.SourcesAdweek: The Power of Emotion in B2B Content Marketing (2019).Burnam, E. (2019, august 23). text: errymedia.co en blog posts why b2b companies should consider breaking the rules in content marketing. Castleberry Media        HomeServicesStrategyProductionDistributionVirtual InfluencersMindpathBlogAbout UsOur Green InitiativeContactSpanishEnSpEnSpWhy B2B Companies Should Consider Breaking the Rules in Content MarketingContent MarketingDecember 12, 2022In today's crowded and competitive content marketing landscape, it is becoming increasingly important for companies to find ways to stand out and differentiate themselves. While traditional content marketing strategies, such as blog posts and infographics, can be effective in some cases, they often need more personalization and relevance to the audience. In this article, we will explore the limitations of traditional content marketing and the benefits of disrupting the status quo to connect with and engage the audience in a more meaningful way.The limitations of traditional content marketingOne of the main limitations of traditional content marketing is its lack of personalization and relevance to the audience. With so much content being produced, it can be difficult for companies to create content that resonates with their target audience and captures their attention. This is particularly true in the B2B content space, where the audience may be more skeptical and less likely to engage with generic content.Another limitation of traditional content marketing is its inability to keep up with the rapid pace of change in the digital landscape. As new platforms, technologies, and trends emerge, companies stuck in their old ways may find themselves left behind. For example, the rise of visual platforms like Instagram and TikTok has pressured businesses to create visually appealing content to compete.Furthermore, the sheer volume of content that is being produced can make it difficult for companies to cut through the noise and reach their audience. According to the Content Marketing Institute, the average business produces over 11,000 pieces of content per year. With so much content being made, it can be challenging for companies to create content that stands out and captures the audience's attention.The benefits of disrupting the status quoDisrupting the status quo in content marketing can provide several benefits. Firstly, it allows for innovation and experimentation, developing new, more compelling content formats and approaches. This can help companies stand out from the competition and capture the audience's attention.Secondly, disrupting the status quo can provide an opportunity to connect with the audience more meaningfully. By thinking outside the box and trying new things, companies can create more personalized, relevant, and engaging content for the target audience. This can help build trust and loyalty, ultimately driving business growth.Tips for disrupting the content marketing industryTo successfully disrupt the content marketing industry, businesses should follow these tips:1. Identify areas for disruption and experimentation in your content strategy: Look for ways to break from the traditional content marketing formats and approaches and try something new and different. This could involve experimenting with new platforms, formats, or content styles.2. Be willing to take risks and try new things: Disrupting the status quo can be risky, but the potential rewards can be significant. Don't be afraid to take a chance and try something new, even if it means stepping outside your comfort zone.â3. Use data and feedback to improve your approach constantly: Disruption doesn't happen overnight. It is a continuous process of experimentation, learning, and improvement. Use data and feedback to understand what is working and what is not, and adjust your approach accordingly.4. Collaborate with other departments and teams: Content marketing is not just the marketing team's responsibility. It should involve collaboration with other departments, such as sales, product, and customer service, to create content that is genuinely aligned with the needs and interests of the audience.Invest in the right tools and resources: Disrupting the content marketing industry requires time, effort, and resources. Invest in the tools and resources that enable you to create and distribute high-quality content at scale. This could include hiring specialized content creators, such as writers, designers, or video producers, or investing in content marketing software.Wrap-upIn today's crowded and competitive content marketing landscape, it is becoming increasingly important for companies to find ways to stand out and differentiate themselves. By disrupting the status quo and experimenting with new formats and approaches, companies can create more personalized, relevant, and engaging content for the audience. This can help to build trust and loyalty and ultimately drive business growth.While disrupting the status quo in content marketing can be risky, the potential rewards are significant. By following the tips outlined above, companies can position themselves as thought leaders and innovators in the industry and ultimately succeed in a crowded and competitive market.ConclusionThe limitations of traditional content marketing, combined with the rapidly changing digital landscape, make it more critical than ever for companies to consider disrupting the status quo to connect with and engage the audience more meaningfully. Companies can create content that stands out and drives business growth by taking risks, experimenting with new approaches, and collaborating with other departments.SourcesOpenIAIn Castleberry Media we are commited to taking care of our planet, therefore, this content is responsible with the environment. text: errymedia.co en blog posts why content marketing is your best strategy. Castleberry Media        HomeServicesStrategyProductionDistributionVirtual InfluencersMindpathBlogAbout UsOur Green InitiativeContactSpanishEnSpEnSpWhy content marketing is your best strategyFinancial IndustryMay 12, 2022Technology is drastically changing financial services and has been doing so for years. Back in 2015, a Deloitte report assured that the banking experience of the future would be completely virtual, customer-oriented, frictionless, and personalized. Today, it is already like that, or at least it is how customers expect it to be.Consumers have gradually understood the potential of digital communications and solutions. Currently, 66% of customers execute half of their banking transactions online, a number that is forecast to continue to grow, according to research from Accenture Strategy. Therefore, creating a seamless digital experience in online channels is a top priority for banks. Doing so can be the key to a financial institution's success.Â One of the best ways to achieve this is to adopt a content marketing strategy. This type of marketing consists of creating, publishing, and distributing relevant content for an audience with the aim of obtaining leads, positioning itself in the customer's mind, strengthening trust in the institution and building customer loyalty. If a bank wants to convince its customers that it is their best option, it can demonstrate it through a strategy based on valuable content.How Strategic Content Marketing Benefits BanksIn a market such as banking, where there is little differentiation between products, the brand affinity and trust that a bank builds among customers is key to remaining relevant. Content marketing helps to achieve these goals and also allows to reach others that are essential for today's banking.Â Reaching younger audiencesOne of the goals of banks is to reach younger audiences. Millennials are at the center of their strategy, as in 2016 they surpassed baby boomers as the largest generation. However, it is not easy for banks to reach this audience: it is a reticent group towards banks.Millennials also tend not to trust disruptive advertising very much. According to the report New money: how top finance brands use content marketing to win in a customer-centric world, published by The Content Strategist, millennials skip YouTube ads as quickly as possible and two-thirds use ad blocking programs.Content is a friendlier option for this audience. 47% of millennials say they would be more likely to trust a financial services company if it created useful content, according to survey data from The Content Strategist. For this reason, companies like BBVA and SoFi have invested in content marketing to help connect with their customers.Improve your organic positioning and brand awarenessCustomers trust commercial messages less and less. When they see an ad, they know the brand has paid for it, which is why they don't pay much attention to what it says. Content marketing doesn't pressure visitors to do something, but instead helps build trust by offering non-promotional information that educates them and helps them solve their problems.A big advantage is that consumers trust content: 40% admit to viewing three to five pieces before communicating with a brand, according to a survey of content preferences by Demand Gen Report. So when banks create relevant content for their audience, they can increase the number of visits to their website and begin to establish their brand as an authority in the industry, as content allows them to position themselves as experts.Educate the audienceBanks use content marketing to add value to their products. Some of the products or services offered by financial institutions may be difficult for the target audience to understand. Well-explained content tailored to the bank's audience can educate them on a topic so that they understand it better.One of the problems facing banking today is the lack of trust in digital media. This occurs mainly among older consumers, as young people tend to trust more. Creating content that can teach the audience about the use of digital tools for banking, for example, can reduce this distrust gap.Â Personalize the experienceÂ Personalization makes it possible to meet the needs of each customer, depending on the stage of the customer journey in which they are, by connecting them with the information they are looking for and need.Â With content marketing, a bank can create attractive and useful content for each of its audience groups. The content that interests a retired person is not the same that appeals to a young person. If a bank uses content as a method of personalization, they can create blog posts focused on retirement to appeal to baby boomers, and others on financial advice for millennials.Another benefit of having a personalized strategy is cost-effectiveness. Increasing personalization across more channels can increase overall consumer spend by up to 500%, according to the study Engage consumers & increase buyer readiness through customer-centric marketing.Â ConclusionBanks such as BBVA or Bancolombia, or investment banking groups such as Goldman Sachs, use content marketing to reach younger audiences, connect with them, increase brand awareness and build customer loyalty.Â However, it is not just about creating lots of content. Having the right processes and tools in place to connect content with audiences is critical to the success of this strategy. The key is data: by analyzing it, you can find out what your target audience is interested in and then generate content aligned with those interests.Â If you would like to learn more about how we can help you create a successful content strategy for the financial sector, please contact us: sales@castleberrymedia.co.âContact us to boost your content marketing strategyThank you! text: errymedia.co en blog posts why diversity and inclusion matters in content marketing and how to do it right. Castleberry Media        HomeServicesStrategyProductionDistributionVirtual InfluencersMindpathBlogAbout UsOur Green InitiativeContactSpanishEnSpEnSpWhy Diversity and Inclusion Matters in Content Marketing and How to Do It RightDecember 21, 2022The value of inclusion and diversity in the workplace is something that companies are increasingly realizing, and this is also true of content marketing. It is essential to produce inclusive and representative content to ensure that your marketing activities are successful and have an influence on audiences in the current business environment.Diversity and Inclusion in Content Marketing: The Business CaseAccording to research, inclusive and varied teams are more creative and productive, and diverse businesses are more likely to outperform their contemporaries. The same reasoning holds true for content marketing. By producing inclusive and representative content, you may show your audience that your company cares for diversity and is devoted to inclusivity. This can increase your content's relatability and engagement with a wide range of audiences while also helping to establish trust and trustworthiness.Building Audience Trust and Credibility Through Diversity and InclusionThere is a compelling ethical justification for producing inclusive and representative content in addition to the business case for diversity and inclusion. Consumers today want businesses to reflect these ideals in their marketing efforts as they become more aware of concerns around diversity and inclusion. By producing inclusive and representational content, you can show your audience that your company is willing to listen to and address the needs and concerns of a varied audience.Techniques for Producing Representative and Inclusive ContentWhat practical ways to provide inclusive and representative content that appeals to your audience? Here are some tactics to take into account:1. To better understand the diversity of your audience, conduct market research.You may better understand whom you are attempting to target and how to develop content that is relevant and interesting to them by collecting information on the demographics, interests, and requirements of your audience. To perform market research, follow these steps:Identify your target market: Specifying precisely who you're aiming to target before you start collecting data is crucial. Age, gender, geography, occupation, income level, and other characteristics pertinent to your company or product should be considered.Collect demographic information: Make sure your material reflects and represents the variety of your audience by looking at their demographics. This can entail including individuals in your material of various ages, genders, races, nationalities, and abilities. You may learn a lot about your audience's demographics through multiple methods. Several possibilities are:- Surveys: To build and disseminate surveys that collect demographic information from your audience, use internet tools or software.- Social media analytics: Many social media platforms come with built-in analytics tools that can help you learn more about the types of people that follow you or utilize your content.- Customer databases: You can utilize this data to comprehend your audience's demographics if you have a customer database.Analyze your requirements and interests: Make sure your content speaks to the wants and desires of your audience by taking these into account. These are some techniques for gathering this data:- Online research: Use tools like Google Analytics or social media analytics to find out what subjects or keywords your audience is interested in. You can also rely on digital tools like Buzzsumo or True Content to identify content and topics of interest.- Customer feedback: Directly inquire about the interests and demands of your customers. Surveys, focus groups, or one-on-one interviews can be used to get this information.- Industry analysis: To determine what your audience is interested in, research market trends and upcoming demands. Synthesize and evaluate the data to gain a thorough insight into your audience.Use the insights to guide your content strategy: Guide your content strategy with the insights you learned from the market research. This will assist you in producing material for your audience that is both relevant and interesting.2. Establish standards and recommended procedures for producing inclusive content.This might include:Imagery and language: Make sure your material is inclusive and respectful of all the people in your audience by using language and imagery that reflects that. This may entail refraining from using words or images that are derogatory, stereotyped, or disparaging of particular communities.Eliminate stereotypes: Stereotypes are overly simplistic and frequently unreliable depictions of particular populations. Avoid employing stereotypes in your material and aim to accurately and sensitively represent people from different backgrounds.Be sensitive to cultural differences: Be sensitive to cultural differences while portraying other groups in your content. This could entail looking into and comprehending various groups' cultural practices and beliefs, as well as avoiding offending or unsuitable content.Avoid being a toke: Tokenism is the practice of including a token amount of various people or groups in your work to make it seem inclusive without addressing diversity and inclusion issues. Strive to accurately reflect and incorporate varied groups in your material rather than using tokenism.3. Engage with diverse content creators and influencers.By partnering with diverse content creators and influencers, you can bring fresh perspectives and voices to your content marketing efforts.You can adhere to these procedures to interact with varied content producers and influencers:Choose your objectives: Establish your goals for collaborations with other influencers and content producers.Â Look into prospective partners: Look for influencers and content producers who share the goals and values of your company. Take into account the engagement rate, content style, and audience demographics.Reach out to potential partners using email, social media, or other methods after identifying them. Introduce yourself, your company, and why you believe cooperation would benefit both parties.Negotiate the conditions: After receiving a favorable response, discuss the partnership's conditions. This could include the kind of content created, how long the collaboration will last, and any financial rewards.Work with your partners to produce engaging, sincere content that appeals to your intended audience.Â Assess: After the relationship is over, assess the outcomes to see if the cooperation was successful. Use this data to inform your future content marketing and partnering initiatives.4. Plan and schedule your material to reflect diversity and inclusion. When creating your content marketing strategy and calendar, prioritize diversity and inclusion.Best Practices in Content Marketing for Promoting Diversity and InclusionThe first step is to provide inclusive and representative material. You must use a variety of best practices if you want to genuinely commit to diversity and inclusion in your content marketing efforts. Here are some to think about:Continuous instruction and training. Make sure your team is knowledgeable about diversity and inclusion and familiar with the rules and ideal procedures for producing inclusive content.Leadership assistance. Making sure that the organization's leadership is dedicated to and actively supporting these values will help to foster a culture of inclusion and diversity.Calculating and monitoring the effects of inclusion and diversity on your content marketing initiatives. You may gauge the impact of your diversity and inclusion efforts on the effectiveness of your content marketing by monitoring important metrics like views, shares, and conversions.ConclusionsAs we've seen, diversity and inclusion are becoming more and more significant factors in the realm of content marketing. You may establish credibility and trust with your audience by producing inclusive and diverse content. This will also help maximize your marketing initiatives' effectiveness and impact. There are many approaches that businesses can use to get started, even while there isn't a single, universal method for producing inclusive and representative content.SourcesOpen IAIn Castleberry Media we are commited to taking care of our planet, therefore, this content is responsible with the environment. fname: errymedia.co en case study content marketing
text: errymedia.co en case study content marketing. Case Study | Content Marketing        HomeServicesStrategyProductionDistributionVirtual InfluencersMindpathBlogAbout UsOur Green InitiativeContactSpanishEnSpEnSpFind out how one of our clients achieved 29% growth in sales by using our services + 1200Contents analysed with AI+29%Sales Growth+8%Growth in EBITDAIncreasing sales by 29% is possible with a data-driven content marketing strategy. Below we share some of the strategies and tactics we used to achieve the goal.* For reasons of confidentiality, we will refer to the client as the brand, the company or our client.In 2018 we began to work with a brand specialised in offering comprehensive office furniture solutions that sought to strengthen its position in the market. By that date, reaching thier target audience was not being as effective as they wanted. The brand had little digital presence and the visits to its page were not very high. For this reason, the company decided to look for alternatives to improve their presence on the Internet, boost sales, and conversions.One of its main objectives was to change the traditional perception that users had about the company. They wanted to become an innovative and cutting-edge brand, as well as attract and captivate new audiences of architects and office project managers. With that goal in mind, we began working together to create a value-added content strategy that would help them connect with her audience.The problem we foundAt that time, our client had a marketing strategy focused on showcasing their products and services; in other words, their entire strategy was only advertisements. While this is an important strategy for any business, today's consumers not only come to brands to buy, but also to learn and get informed. That is the reason why content marketing has become a successful strategy. With it, we can offer valuable content to the audience, something especially important for the youngest such as millennials and centennials, who are the main target audience of this client. In addition to educating the audience, with content marketing, brands can position themselves as experts, increase customer loyalty, improve their brand positioning and obtaining many other benefits.What we didTo successfully implement this strategy, it is essential to follow a few steps, mainly knowing the audience in depth. We adopt a comprehensive solution in which we first developed the content marketing strategy based on the content consumption data of the target audience. Additionally, we define the brand's content territory, content verticals, formats, and keywords. Additionally, at Castleberry Media we have a method that allows us to discover key information for brands such as:What the best in your industry in the world do. What are the most successful contents of your category in the world. Which topics are the most successful contents in the world for your niche. How the best positioned content is written. the interests of your audience and what they are looking for. Who creates content for your audience.Once this was done, we carried out a monthly program -still in progress- of content production based on the data-collected. We have recently started optimising the contents of the brand with True ContentÂ®, our AI-powered tool. Additionally, we work together with industry experts, who review the texts produced to ensure that the information is accurate, current and relevant to the brand's audience. Once the content is ready, we distribute it natively in the main digital media. consumed by the target audience.How did we do it?After identifying the general audience of the brand and analysing the relevant media, clients, prospects and competitors, we create specific content for its target audience, which are the specifying architects and project managers. To position the brand according to the different stages of the sales funnel, initially we created some content for the bottom of the funnel. One of these pieces was Eight keys to choose the best supplier, which aimed to help the audience that had already considered the brand as an option to make the decision to buy. These contents helped the company to move its prospects towards the sale.Subsequently, we created a lot of content for the top of the funnel, with articles such as How to design the ideal office? or The psychological impact of remote work, to start positioning the page in Google and in the minds of the audience. That has been our central objective until 2021; In 2022 we are going to use some technological tools such as Mindpath, which allows us to use content to guide our actions to companies that show interest in our client. Moreover, the content we produce at Castleberry Media for our clients is evergreen. This type of content does not lose relevance over time and therefore can constantly attract traffic to the website. These posts are ideal for increasing search engine rankings for months or years. For this reason, we consider evergreen content to be the foundation of a good long-term content marketing strategy.OurÂ Results?Currently, the client does some events and guidelines during the year. However, its main marketing strategy is based 90% on content marketing. Thanks to the fact that the brand has been creating valuable content for its audience for several years, it is increasingly better positioned in search engines such as Google. In the past, the company did not receive requests for quotes online. Now that its digital presence has increased and the brand has become more visible, the result has been positive. It currently trades more than $1.5 million per quarter in online applications. Success is reflected in your sales. Between 2018 and 2019, the company increased its sales by 29% as a result of the content strategy, as well as other marketing initiatives. Today three months' sales are enough to pay for a year's content marketing strategy. Over the years, their visits have grown substantially. Thanks to the native distribution of content, from 2018 to 2020 it accumulates more than 75,000 visitors to the content of its blog. With the articles created, posts were also extracted for social networks, with which excellent results have been achieved. Their visits have grown by 250% and the engagement of the audience has had an average growth of over 150%.The objective of the brand is to continue growing and strengthening its audience. Therefore, our next task is to help them create an online community to engage their target audience with content specific to their niche. Currently, this community is made up of twenty B2B companies, which were initially attracted with the general content strategy. At the beginning of our commercial relationship, the company had doubts regarding the content marketing strategy, especially due to the time that this type of initiative usually takes. However, he gave us a vote of confidence that has been fruitful for both parties. Now the company connects more deeply with its audience and its audience feels that the brand understands them and offers them useful and relevant content, which translates into higher sales. This is evidenced by the growth of EBITDA (earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization) of 8%. In Castleberry we help brands persuade their audiences with content marketing. To better understand how we support the growth of medium and large companies, please contact us at sales@castleberrymedia.co.Data, AI and content marketingWould you like to understand our products and services better? text: errymedia.co en e book 5 examples of content marketing in banking. E-book | 5 examples of content marketing in banking        InicioServiciosEstrategiaProducciÃ³nDistribuciÃ³nInfluenciadores VirtualesMindpathBlogNosotrosIniciativa AmbientalContactoEnglishEnSpEnSp5 examples of content marketing in bankingBanking consumer behavior and preferences have changed. Furthermore, we now live in a digital world. That is why banks need to find their audience wherever it is. Customers often search for keywords, read blogs, use financial calculators, visit social media accounts, conduct surveys, review white papers and even case studies to learn about a topic before ordering a product or service.If you expect potential customers to come to your website only because you offer good services or products, and you don't create a solid strategy that drives them to become customers, you could go a long time without conversions.Content marketing allows educating customers with relevant information to drive their purchase decision. It is an ideal strategy to reach consumers organically and attract the attention of millennials, the generation that increasingly trusts banks less: in fact, in 2017 about 80% of millennials trusted large banks, and by 2020 that figure had dropped to 51%, according to a research by The Tokenist.Â Â How are banks embracing content marketing?Less than 40% of banks have a documented content marketing strategy, according to the Content Marketing Institute. Most financial institutions that use this strategy publish random content, often with a promotional tone, so they do not connect with the audience and usually go unnoticed.Â However, there are other banks that have managed to carry out a solid content strategy that has allowed them to offer a personalized experience to their customers and meet their expectations. Below are five companies in the financial sector that are making a difference.Â Â 1. Morgan StanleyThe website of the American financial multinational Morgan Stanley looks more like a media outlet such as The Wall Street Journal than a bank. It has a highly developed content strategy, focused on in-depth and prompt financial articles for its audience.After doing a study with our True Content tool, which uses artificial intelligence, the main topics that Morgan Stanley showcases are economic development, financial recovery, stock markets, labor markets and financial growth. For this reason, the company decided to look for alternatives to improve their presence on the Internet, boost sales, and conversions.One of its main objectives was to change the traditional perception that users had about the company. With that goal in mind, we began working together to create a value-added content strategy that would help them connect with her audience.The problem we foundAt that time, our client had a marketing strategy focused on showcasing their products and services; in other words, their entire strategy was only advertisements. While this is an important strategy for any business, today's consumers not only come to brands to buy, but also to learn and get informed. That is the reason why content marketing has become a successful strategy. With it, we can offer valuable content to the audience, something especially important for the youngest such as millennials and centennials, who are the main target audience of this client. We adopt a comprehensive solution in which we first developed the content marketing strategy based on the content consumption data of the target audience. Additionally, we define the brand's content territory, content verticals, formats, and keywords. What are the most successful contents of your category in the world. Which topics are the most successful contents in the world for your niche. How the best positioned content is written. the interests of your audience and what they are looking for. Additionally, we work together with industry experts, who review the texts produced to ensure that the information is accurate, current and relevant to the brand's audience. Once the content is ready, we distribute it natively in the main digital media. consumed by the target audience.How did we do it?After identifying the general audience of the brand and analysing the relevant media, clients, prospects and competitors, we create specific content for its target audience, which are the specifying architects and project managers. To position the brand according to the different stages of the sales funnel, initially we created some content for the bottom of the funnel. One of these pieces was Eight keys to choose the best supplier, which aimed to help the audience that had already considered the brand as an option to make the decision to buy. These contents helped the company to move its prospects towards the sale.Subsequently, we created a lot of content for the top of the funnel, with articles such as How to design the ideal office? or The psychological impact of remote work, to start positioning the page in Google and in the minds of the audience. That has been our central objective until 2021; In 2022 we are going to use some technological tools such as Mindpath, which allows us to use content to guide our actions to companies that show interest in our client. Moreover, the content we produce at Castleberry Media for our clients is evergreen. This type of content does not lose relevance over time and therefore can constantly attract traffic to the website. These posts are ideal for increasing search engine rankings for months or years. For this reason, we consider evergreen content to be the foundation of a good long-term content marketing strategy.OurÂ Results?Currently, the client does some events and guidelines during the year. However, its main marketing strategy is based 90% on content marketing. Thanks to the fact that the brand has been creating valuable content for its audience for several years, it is increasingly better positioned in search engines such as Google. In the past, the company did not receive requests for quotes online. Now that its digital presence has increased and the brand has become more visible, the result has been positive. It currently trades more than $1.5 million per quarter in online applications. Success is reflected in your sales. Between 2018 and 2019, the company increased its sales by 29% as a result of the content strategy, as well as other marketing initiatives. Today three months' sales are enough to pay for a year's content marketing strategy. Over the years, their visits have grown substantially. Thanks to the native distribution of content, from 2018 to 2020 it accumulates more than 75,000 visitors to the content of its blog. With the articles created, posts were also extracted for social networks, with which excellent results have been achieved. Their visits have grown by 250% and the engagement of the audience has had an average growth of over 150%.The objective of the brand is to continue growing and strengthening its audience. Therefore, our next task is to help them create an online community to engage their target audience with content specific to their niche. Currently, this community is made up of twenty B2B companies, which were initially attracted with the general content strategy. At the beginning of our commercial relationship, the company had doubts regarding the content marketing strategy, especially due to the time that this type of initiative usually takes. However, he gave us a vote of confidence that has been fruitful for both parties. Now the company connects more deeply with its audience and its audience feels that the brand understands them and offers them useful and relevant content, which translates into higher sales.
